Overview   Package  Class  Use  Tree  Deprecated  Index  Help 
 PREV PACKAGE   NEXT PACKAGE FRAMES    NO FRAMES    

Package fiarautoplayer

Interface Summary
IAlgorithm Basic interface for a playing/learning algorithm
IFeatureExtractor Interface for feature extraction from board according to color and current state
LearnStatisticsListener Listener for collection of statistics at endplay
PlayEventsListener Interface for a listener to play events when in play mode
TestStatisticsListener  
 

Class Summary
Consts Various game and xml constants
EpsilonUpdate Class in charge of managing epsilon policy over time
FIARFeatureExtractor Main class in charge of extracting all features from board
FIARLearnerState Represents the state of the learning process It holds the values of the learning parameters, number of simulated games used in the learning process and the learned weights of the function approximators
FIARState Representation of board state
GameManagerRLGamer Adapter class between the game manager infrastructure and our internal framework reports game events to a PlayEventsListener.
GreedyQPolicy Implementation of an epsilon greedy Q value policy
HardCodedMoves This calss encapsulates the hard coded moves used in the training process
LearnManager Main class to handle running games and learning process
LearnStatisticsFileWriter Writes learning process statistics to a csv log with the following columns: Game num – game number in learn sequence Winners Color – color of the winner, indicates first (RED) or second player (BLACK) Num of turns – Number of plys the game took Game sequence – space separated integer list representing the moves sequence maxUpdateDelta – the maximal Q error of the sarsa update rule during the game
LinearFunctionApproximator Class implementing a linear function approximator Used for evaluation of linear function given a set of weights and features
Minimax Implementation of Minimax search algorithm
QFunctionApproximator Representation of Q Function approximator for player Holds a linear function approximator for each move(column) and provides functions for updating weights and evaluation of Q function
RLGamer This class represents a player in a 2 player board game holds an IAlgorithm that implements the play policy
SARSALearner Class responsible for the implementation of SARSA Q-Learning algorithm.
TestManager Class that compares two player configurations by running them against eachother
 

Enum Summary
CellState Enum of possible states for a cell on the board
Color Enum that represents player colors
EpsilonUpdate.UpdateTypes  
Move Represents possible moves on the board (ONE till EIGHT)
